verse.roman:
kṛṣṇa-sandarśanāhlāda
dhvasta-saṁrodhana-klamāḥ
praśaśaṁsur hṛṣīkeśaṁ
gīrbhiḥ prāñjalayo nṛpāḥ

synonyms: kṛṣṇa-sandarśana—of seeing Lord Kṛṣṇa; āhlāda—by the ecstasy; dhvasta—eradicated; saṁrodhana—of imprisonment; klamāḥ—whose weariness; praśaśaṁsuḥ—they praised; hṛṣīkā-īśam—the supreme master of the senses; gīrbhiḥ—with their words; prāñjalayaḥ—with joined palms; nṛpāḥ—the kings.
translation: The ecstasy of beholding Lord Kṛṣṇa having dispelled the weariness of their imprisonment, the kings stood with joined palms and offered words of praise to that supreme master of the senses.
